resources.string: View image with and without Beautify

Front camera background blur is on

Flash is working in the Soft light mode

Soft flash is on in flashlight mode

Located near the left edge of the frame

Located near the right edge of the frame

Located near the upper edge of the frame
Turned off shooting in landscape mode
Open the menu with PRO parameters
Open the panel with reference line options
Take a photo while shooting a video
Turned off Ultra wide angle mode
Turned on Ultra wide angle mode
Button for taking photos while shooting videos
"Recognize scenes using AI and adjust preferences automatically"
Allow Camera to access your location to get more relevant watermarks
Fill light will be turned on when you tap the shutter button
When shooting on a crowded street, ask your subject to stand still. Other people will appear as blurry trails.
You can also take pictures of busy traffic and moving crowds. Long exposure will keep the buildings crisp, but all moving objects will be blurry.
Use a light source to \"paint\" over a dark scene to bring all the lit pieces together in one image.
Use this mode in places with low light pollution. The exposure will be set to %d seconds, so using a tripod is a great idea.
Use this mode in places with low light pollution. The exposure can be set up to %d seconds, so using a tripod is a great idea.
Use this mode when shooting moving clouds. It will give the sky an \"oil painting\" effect.
This mode makes moving water (rivers, waterfalls, and lakes) look like satin.
"Shooting the starry sky for a long time can capture the trajectories of stars. Don't forget to use a tripod and shoot continuously for at least %d minutes."
"Shooting the starry sky for a long time can capture the trajectories of stars. Don't forget to use a tripod! Shoot continuously for at least %d minutes to be able to get both photos and videos."
At night, you can capture the trajectory of bright moving lights (on cars and ships, for example). This mode allows to preview the final result on your screen in real time.
Use a tripod to capture a longer exposure
Try f/%s aperture in low light conditions
"Can't adjust aperture with the current zoom ratio"
"Can't adjust aperture when taking photos close up"
Aperture can only be adjusted for the main camera
Monitor the volume of the left and right channels in real time and adjust it using the slider
Multiple people detected. Switch to 0.6X for best effect.
"Tap an object to keep it in focus while it's moving. Stay at least %d meters away for best effect."
Shoot in landscape mode for best effect
Auxiliary lens is recognizing low light
Keep your subject within 1.5 meters for best effect
Figure effects work only for one person shots
Create professional-grade bokeh and turn your shots into remarkable portraits.
Blur the background while keeping all the detail in the fur and whiskers!
Bring the yummy stuff to the foreground and make it look more vibrant.
Enhance textures and create poster-level stills.
Use large aperture to blur the background and make the items in the foreground stand out.
Allow this app to access the connection status of Bluetooth earphones to be able to use this feature normally.
"For determining the connection status of Bluetooth earphones and recording audio using the earphones' microphone"
Allow this app to connect to nearby devices in Settings to be able to connect to Bluetooth earphones.
You can record up to %1$d minutes in 8K
You can record up to %d minutes of video in the current resolution
You can record up to %d minutes
You can record up to %d minutes in 4K
For taking photos and recording videos
"Welcome to Camera! You can use this app to take photos and record videos. "
"To provide you with additional services while you're using the app, we might need the permissions to access your location."
"To provide additional services while you're using the app, we might ask for permission to access your location and your device's call status."
For detecting calls while recording videos
For saving and displaying photos and videos
For storing and displaying images, videos, and files
For displaying images, videos, and audios
For accessing and displaying audio files on this device
For accessing and displaying photos and videos
"Still can't connect to camera. Try restarting your device."
Taking photo, keep the device still
Your device is overheated. Camera will be closed in %d seconds. Your photos or videos will be saved automatically.
Turn on Wi-Fi in Control center first.
Turn on Wi-Fi in Control center first.
"Connect phones and tablets to the same network to unite them into a single multicam setup. You'll be able to use connected devices as cameras and monitors and shoot one scene from multiple angles."

"Connect phones and tablets to the same network to unite them into a single multicam setup. You'll be able to use connected devices as cameras and monitors and shoot one scene from multiple angles. If your network environment prevents monitor feeds from working seamlessly, the recording process will still remain stable."
Camera %s disconnected from multicam setup due to an error
"Switch to a %s GHz network to boost monitor feed's stability"
"Shoot a subject that's moving all the way across the screen."
Your subject can ski, play basketball, dance, or simply walk.
Frozen frames will be \"picked up\" while the video is playing.
Avoid moving objects and monotone backgrounds.
Hold your device steady and make sure your subject is sufficiently lit.
Come up with your own ideas.
Cloning only works in landscape mode
Tap the shutter button to start
Too much movement. Try starting over.
Return your device to the original position
You moved the device too far. Stopped capturing for now.
Turned off flash due to overheating
"Can't use flash due to low battery"
"Your device is overheated. Can't use flash now."
Charge your device to be able to set exposure
Cool down your device to be able to set exposure
This high-contrast filter retains only yellow and dark blue colors. Use it on well-lit streets of a night city.
A color scheme commonly used in movies adds green to the darker areas. This filter works well for high-contrast scenes such as dusk in the city.
The combination of high contrast and saturation brings out the tang of passion and ardor.
This unique combination of colors works perfect in cloudy weather and soft light.
Dark tones and soft contrast are suitable for soft-lit indoor scenes.
Brownish tones and medium contrast create a warm atmosphere for outdoor scenes shot in natural light.
High contrast and low saturation will bring cinematic feel to most scenes.
A classic movie trick that makes dark areas colder and lights warmer. This filter will freshen up both the urban jungle and great outdoors.
"Scanner allows you to scan QR codes, barcodes, and more. You don't have to connect to the internet to install it."

string.name: confirm_location_message
string.Data:
Welcome to Camera! Tagging your photos and videos with the locations where they are taken will make your Gallery more organized and help you find items faster. Some features might not be available if you restrict adding location info.

We shall protect your personal information in accordance with the relevant laws, regulations, and privacy policies.

resources.string: "Another app may already be using the device's microphone to record."
Reset all parameters to their default values?
"Dolby Vision doesn't support Motion tracking focus and 720P/8K resolution. Turn on anyway?"
Multicam setup uses more bandwidth to reduce latency. We recommend connecting to %s GHz Wi-Fi networks that support the sixth generation standard.
"Multicam setup uses more bandwidth to reduce latency. We recommend connecting to %s GHz Wi-Fi networks that support the sixth generation standard."
"Look into the camera and double tap the screen to zoom in and center align your face (Works only with one person in the frame)"

Welcome to Fun Cam! You can use this app to take photos and record videos. To be able to work normally, this app need to connect to the internet and requires the following permissions in order to collect your personal information:
Mandatory permissions (used for basic features and services of this app)

string.name: cta_mimoji_user_links
string.Data: Read and agree to our User Agreement and Privacy Policy before using this app.

resources.string: "If you don't agree to grant mandatory permissions or share and upload your personal information, you won't be able to use this app. If you don't grant optional permissions, you won't be able to use some features of this app; however, its basic functionality will still be available to you. You can always restrict permissions or withdraw your consent in the Settings."
Welcome to Camera! You can use this app to take photos and shoot videos. This app needs to connect to the internet and requires the following optional permissions:
For adding location info to photos and videos
For accessing and displaying audio files
For accessing and displaying photos and videos
"Optional permissions (Used for additional features while you're using them)"
For recording audio while shooting videos

string.name: cta_user_tips
string.Data: To fully understand your rights as a user as well as the ways in which we use your data, read and agree to our User Agreement and Privacy Policy.

resources.string: "Can't use the text you entered. Try something else instead."
This text will appear as the second line of your watermark. It can contain up to 18 letters or 14 Chinese characters.
Up to %1$d Chinese characters or %2$d letters.
The text you entered is too long
Take stunning photos with Master‑lens system
Fold your device to use the front camera
Flash is on. Cold light selected.

To be able to add location info to your photos and videos, allow Camera to access your location first.
The lens is dirty. Wipe it clean.
"Line up and enhance scanned documents automatically"
Place your subject into the frame
Keep your subject in the center and move the device away steadily
Lost track of the subject. Start over.
You moved the device too far away. Start over.
Move your subject to the center of the frame

Try to avoid large areas of solid color.
Place your subject into the frame.
Ask your subject not to move.

Move the device away from your subject steadily.
Download feature plug-ins automatically when this device is connected to Wi-Fi?
Download feature plug-ins automatically when this device is connected to Wi-Fi?

"You're connected to Wi-Fi. Download this %1$s MB file now?"

"Looks like your device isn't connected to Wi-Fi. Use %1$s MB of mobile data to download items now?"
The camera is too close to the object.
"Make sure the object isn't further than 2 meters."
To create multicam videos, select two cameras on your device and shoot simultaneously. The recordings can be stored separately, or combined in a split view or picture-in-picture video.
"Multicam videos are shot with multiple cameras simultaneously. Dual phone recording also allows you to connect to the another nearby device and create a multicam video by selecting \"Combined\"."
Shoot with two cameras simultaneously and combine recordings in a split view or picture-in-picture video.
Two recordings can be combined in a split view or picture-in-picture video.
"Combine feeds from two different devices into one video. You'll be able to preview both feeds and the final video on this device. Note that audio will only be recorded by this device."
Shoot with two cameras simultaneously and save both recordings as separate videos.
Simultaneously recorded videos can be also separated and saved as two files.
Time freeze videos can only be recorded in landscape orientation
Tap the shutter to start recording
Turn device around to use camera
Turn device around to use camera
Switch cameras on outer screen and turn device around to go back to inner screen
"Close outer screen's camera to go back to inner screen"
Slow-motion capture will start at the last quarter of the recording
The devices will be disconnected from each other if you continue. End this session now?
%1$s wants to connect to this device
Assist cam allows sharing live previews between two devices connected to the same network and taking photos with one device from the other one.
Looks like no photos were taken during this session
Keep two devices within %s meters from each other and open Assist cam on both of them.

"To make the devices visible to each other, connect both of them to the same Wi-Fi network or connect one device to the other via the portable hotspot. Connecting the devices via the hotspot might be more reliable, as external Wi-Fi networks might not allow the devices to be discoverable."

"To make the devices visible to each other, connect both of them to the same Wi-Fi network or connect one device to the other via the portable hotspot. Connecting the devices via the hotspot might be more reliable, as external Wi-Fi networks might not allow the devices to be discoverable."

"Select the device you want to connect to, send an invitation, and accept it on the other device. Use Assist cam in a stable network environment; otherwise, you might experience delay. If you're using a hotspot to connect, set its AP band to %s GHz in Settings > Connection & sharing > Portable hotspot > Set up portable hotspot."
Assist cam allows sharing live previews between two devices and taking photos with one device from the other one.
To be able to use Assist cam, connect to a Wi-Fi network or hotspot first.
To be able to use Assist cam, connect to a Wi-Fi network or hotspot first.
Connect two devices to the same Wi-Fi network or hotspot and open Assist cam to be able to take photos with one device from the other one.
Connect two devices to the same Wi-Fi network or hotspot and open Assist cam to be able to take photos with one device from the other one.
To be able to use this feature, unlock your device first.

string.name: network_access_user_notice_message_live_video
string.Data:
"Camera needs to connect to the internet to provide effects, music, and other features for short videos.

By tapping \"Agree\" below, you're agreeing to our User Agreement and Privacy Policy, and allowing Camera to connect to the internet."

string.name: network_access_user_notice_message_mi_live_video
string.Data:
Welcome to short videos! Our service needs to connect to the network to provide you with music and other features.

Before using our service, you need to read and agree to our User Agreement and Privacy Policy, as well as allow the app to connect to the internet.

string.name: network_access_user_notice_message_sticker
string.Data:
"Camera needs to connect to the internet to provide stickers for this feature.

By tapping \"Agree\" below, you're agreeing to our User Agreement and Privacy Policy, and allowing Camera to connect to the internet."

string.name: network_access_user_notice_message_voice_caption
string.Data:
"Camera needs to connect to the internet to provide speech-to-text output functionality.

By tapping \"Agree\" below, you're agreeing to our User Agreement and Privacy Policy, and allowing Camera to connect to the internet."

resources.string: Turn on Bluetooth and Wi-Fi in Control center to be able to use Dual phone recording.
Turn on Bluetooth and Wi-Fi in Control center to be able to use Dual phone recording.
Use watermarks to protect your documents from unauthorized copying
Insert SD card before using camera
To select an object, simultaneously tap two diagonal points around its border.
"This feature can't be used in multi-window mode"
"Still can't connect to camera. Try restarting your device."
"Your device is overheated. Can't use flash now."
Cool down your device to be able to set exposure
Notify about current orientation when the device is parallel to the ground while taking photos and scanning documents
Notify about current orientation when the device is parallel to the ground
Keep your device steady while taking a photo
Tap the arrow to change direction
Move your device continuously along the line
Align the arrow with the reference line
Tap the arrow to switch direction and begin panning slowly.
The camera can automatically select the aperture based on the current environment. If you choose to adjust the aperture manually, remember that the smaller its value, the more light hits the sensor.
Take more creative control over your photos and videos
You can drag the exposure ring away from the focus ring and adjust the two parameters separately.

"Automatic shutter speed is determined by the camera's light meter. When you select shutter speed manually, remember that the longer the shutter is open, the more light gets on the sensor, making your image brighter."
This feature allows you to compensate exposure when you want your image to be brighter or darker than the meter suggests.
Highlight underexposed areas in blue and overexposed areas in red to be able to adjust exposure correctly.
You can focus both manually and automatically. The greater focus value you select on the slider, the farther from the lens the in-focus area will be.

Histogram is a real-time representation of exposure indicating the darkest parts of your scene on the left going across to the brightest parts on the right. The vertical part of the scale shows how much of the scene is bright or dark.

ISO values can be determined automatically by the light meter. You can also change the value manually. Remember that higher ISO makes your camera more sensitive to light, but brings more digital noise into your image.
"You can switch between multiple available lenses: "
You can switch between multiple available lenses: WIDE (wide angle lens)
You can switch between multiple available lenses: WIDE (wide angle lens), MACRO (macro lens)
You can switch between multiple available lenses: UW (ultra wide angle lens), WIDE (wide angle lens)
You can switch between multiple available lenses: UW (ultra wide angle lens), WIDE (wide angle lens), MACRO (macro lens)
You can switch between multiple available lenses: UW (ultra wide angle lens), WIDE (wide angle lens), TELE (telephoto lens)
You can switch between multiple available lenses: UW (ultra wide angle lens), WIDE (wide angle lens), TELE-%1$sX (telephoto lens)
You can switch between multiple available lenses: UW (ultra wide angle lens), WIDE (wide angle lens), TELE-%1$sX (telephoto lens), TELE-%2$sX (telephoto lens)
This format records video with logarithmic function applied to the exposure curve in order to capture more details in highlights and shadows, giving you more options in post-processing.
Turn on LOG to import customized LUTs for video previews. Videos will be recorded in LOG files.

Saturation allows you to control the depth and intensity of colors, adjusting contrast brings out or minimizes the difference between light and dark, and sharpness renders the details along the outlines.

Use tonal adjustments to increase contrast or lower it and make the image more layered. Experiment with different hues to give your photos a warmer or cooler look. Decide whether you want crisper details or lowered sharpness for a more delicate feel.

Average metering takes into account all areas of your image, working best for evenly lit scenes. Center-weighted metering mainly focuses on the central area of the frame and gives due consideration to the brightness of the surrounding area, which is suitable for shooting subjects in the center of the frame. Spot metering only covers the area in one spot, giving you precise control over the exposure.
"When you're focusing manually, use focus peaking to place a red highlight on in-focus area."
Use focus peaking to place green highlights on the in-focus area when focusing manually.
This image format captures all image data recorded by the sensor when you take a photo. Uncompressed data gives you more options in post-processing.
RAW files capture uncompressed data and offer more image editing options.
"RAW files capture uncompressed data and offer more image editing options. Ultra RAW images save %d bit of data keeping even more detail."
Besides the white balance presets (incandescent, daylight, fluorescent, cloudy), you can also set white balance to a custom value within the %1$d-%2$d Kelvin range.
Drag the zoom slider horizontally to change your shot smoothly from a long shot to a close-up.
Looks like somebody in the frame closed their eyes
Looks like the person in the frame closed their eyes
Looks like the lense is partly covered
Make sure the environment is well lit
"Use Portrait mode to blur the background on your photos"
"Portrait mode blurs the background and brings out the people in the front."
"Try Portrait mode. Keep the subject sharp while blurring the background."
Make Camera more responsive by allowing it to autostart. You can manage autostart permissions in app details.
Adjust makeup effects for men on group photos
Remove moles when skin smoothening effects are used
Select best moment automatically when pressing the shutter button
To select an object, tap two diagonal points around its border. When the object is stationary, the camera will snap a shot automatically.
Turn off screen after %d minutes of inactivity to save power while recording regular or time-lapse videos, using timed bursts or long exposure
While shooting, turn off screen after %d minutes of inactivity to save power
Apply smart cropping to improve composition of super resolution images
Frame rate will be lowered automatically in low light or high temperature conditions to improve video quality
Reduce frame rate for videos in low light or high temperature environments automatically
Adjust frame rate to low light
The duration of a shooting session is unlimited by default. You can also set the timer which will stop the session at a fixed moment.
Time-lapse videos shot at higher speed are shorter and more condensed. Here are the speed values suitable for different scenes:
Tap to focus, then tap again to take a photo.
"High efficiency image file format saves storage space in Photo and Ultra HD modes, but isn't supported by some third party apps. You can't take dynamic shots and remove watermarks in HEIF."
"Photos in high efficiency image file format take up less storage space, but aren't supported by some apps"
"High efficiency image file format saves storage space, but isn't supported by some third party apps. You can't take dynamic shots and remove watermarks in HEIF."
"High efficiency image file format saves storage space, but isn't supported by some third party apps. You can't remove watermarks in HEIF."
Improve image quality using the smart algorithm. Image capture speed may decrease when this feature is on. Night mode will be turned on automatically when low light conditions are detected.
Press & hold Shutter button to lock AE/AF/AWB
Notify about current orientation when the device is parallel to the ground while taking photos and scanning documents
Notify about current orientation when the phone is parallel to the ground
Correct distorted faces of the people who are close to the edge of the frame
Correct face distortions on group photos
Drag the shutter button to the left to add an additional floating shutter, which can be placed anywhere on the screen
Track motion to minimize blur on the photos of children, pets, and other active subjects
You can only import CUBE files.
You can import up to %d files
"LUTs are only applied to previews while you're recording videos"
Lock touch gestures when placed in a pocket
Show age when Beautify is on
Show age and gender when Beautify is on
Press and hold the Volume down button when the screen is off to take a photo
Drag the shutter button up to create an additional floating shutter
Tap the preview screen to take a photo
延长触摸对焦超时时间
Track eye movement to keep eyes in focus when one person is in the frame

When you take photos or shoot videos with moving subjects, this feature detects people, cats, and dogs, and keeps them in focus automatically. Additionally, you can also double tap any subject to track motion.
Keep moving people, cats, and dogs in focus automatically or double tap any subject to track
Correct distortion in ultra wide shots
开启视频平滑变焦功能
Show face frame in Video mode

Only works in modes that support zoom
"Show front camera position when it's being used"

Record sound via external microphone when mic-equipped Bluetooth earphones are connected
Reduce noises generated behind the front camera
Record high resolution videos in HDR10+/HDR10 to optimize colors and dynamic range. Recorded videos can be played only on HDR10+/HDR10 compatible devices.
Optimize colors and contrast for 4K and 8k videos automatically. Optimized videos can only be played on HDR10 compatible devices.
Optimize colors and adjust contrast for 4K and 8K videos. This feature only works on HDR10+ compatible devices.
Use HLG technology to enhance colors and dynamic range of the videos recorded in high resolution
Monitor recorded sound using wired earphones when they are connected
Receive a notification when the lens is dirty
Works for videos in Pro and Time-lapse modes

You can only record 720p videos with 960fps

Preserve Beautify preferences selected during the previous session

Preserve the previously used mode rather than automatically reset to default preferences
Preserve dynamic shots status set during the previous session
Reduce noise in videos depending on the scene
Only the rear camera can scan QR codes in the \"Photo\" mode.

Detect low light conditions and improve image quality automatically

Stunning visual experience, lifelike details, and striking contrast

Sounds from behind the screen are filtered in landscape mode

"Don't unfold the device until the video is saved"

Use landscape mode for best effect
Turn off Dual phone recording now?
Disconnect and exit Dual phone recording now?
Turn on Dual phone recording on the other device using the Control center toggle.

"Dual phone recording allows combining feeds from two different devices which are close to each other into one video. You'll be able to preview both feeds and the final video on this device. Note that audio will only be recorded by this device."
To make this feature work, the other Mi or Redmi device must support Dual phone recording. It can be turned on using the Control center toggle.
